[AABB] consists of a position, a size, and several utility functions. It is typically used for fast overlap tests.
		It uses floating-point coordinates. The 2D counterpart to [AABB] is [Rect2].
		[b]Note:[/b] Unlike [Rect2], [AABB] does not have a variant that uses integer coordinates.

member.value:
If [code]true[/code], the dialog is hidden when the OK button is pressed. You can set it to [code]false[/code] if you want to do e.g. input validation when receiving the [signal confirmed] signal, and handle hiding the dialog in your own logic.
			[b]Note:[/b] Some nodes derived from this class can have a different default value, and potentially their own built-in logic overriding this setting. For example [FileDialog] defaults to [code]false[/code], and has its own input validation code that is called when you press OK, which eventually hides the dialog if the input is valid. As such, this property can't be used in [FileDialog] to disable hiding the dialog when pressing OK.

class.brief_description: Sprite node that can use multiple textures for animation.
class.description:
Animations are created using a [SpriteFrames] resource, which can be configured in the editor via the SpriteFrames panel.
		[b]Note:[/b] You can associate a set of normal maps by creating additional [SpriteFrames] resources with a [code]_normal[/code] suffix. For example, having 2 [SpriteFrames] resources [code]run[/code] and [code]run_normal[/code] will make it so the [code]run[/code] animation uses the normal map.

member.value: Sets the currently visible frame of the texture.
member.name: current_frame

member.value:
Animation speed in frames per second. This value defines the default time interval between two frames of the animation, and thus the overall duration of the animation loop based on the [member frames] property. A value of 0 means no predefined number of frames per second, the animation will play according to each frame's frame delay (see [method set_frame_delay]).
			For example, an animation with 8 frames, no frame delay and a [code]fps[/code] value of 2 will run for 4 seconds, with each frame lasting 0.5 seconds.
member.name: fps

member.value: Number of frames to use in the animation. While you can create the frames independently with [method set_frame_texture], you need to set this value for the animation to take new frames into account. The maximum number of frames is [constant MAX_FRAMES].
member.name: frames

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the animation will only play once and will not loop back to the first frame after reaching the end. Note that reaching the end will not set [member pause] to [code]true[/code].
member.name: oneshot

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the animation will pause where it currently is (i.e. at [member current_frame]). The animation will continue from where it was paused when changing this property to [code]false[/code].
member.name: pause

method.name: get_frame_delay
method.description: Returns the given frame's delay value.

method.name: get_frame_texture
method.description: Returns the given frame's [Texture].

method.name: set_frame_delay
method.description:
Sets an additional delay (in seconds) between this frame and the next one, that will be added to the time interval defined by [member fps]. By default, frames have no delay defined. If a delay value is defined, the final time interval between this frame and the next will be [code]1.0 / fps + delay[/code].
				For example, for an animation with 3 frames, 2 FPS and a frame delay on the second frame of 1.2, the resulting playback will be:
				[codeblock]
				Frame 0: 0.5 s (1 / fps)
				Frame 1: 1.7 s (1 / fps + 1.2)
				Frame 2: 0.5 s (1 / fps)
				Total duration: 2.7 s
				[/codeblock]

method.name: set_frame_texture
method.description:
Assigns a [Texture] to the given frame. Frame IDs start at 0, so the first frame has ID 0, and the last frame of the animation has ID [member frames] - 1.
				You can define any number of textures up to [constant MAX_FRAMES], but keep in mind that only frames from 0 to [member frames] - 1 will be part of the animation.

class.name: AnimatedTexture
class.brief_description: Proxy texture for simple frame-based animations.
class.description:
[AnimatedTexture] is a resource format for frame-based animations, where multiple textures can be chained automatically with a predefined delay for each frame. Unlike [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimatedSprite], it isn't a [Node], but has the advantage of being usable anywhere a [Texture] resource can be used, e.g. in a [TileSet].
		The playback of the animation is controlled by the [member fps] property as well as each frame's optional delay (see [method set_frame_delay]). The animation loops, i.e. it will restart at frame 0 automatically after playing the last frame.
		[AnimatedTexture] currently requires all frame textures to have the same size, otherwise the bigger ones will be cropped to match the smallest one.
		[b]Note:[/b] AnimatedTexture doesn't support using [AtlasTexture]s. Each frame needs to be a separate [Texture].

class.brief_description: Playback control for [AnimationNodeStateMachine].
class.description:
Allows control of [AnimationTree] state machines created with [AnimationNodeStateMachine]. Retrieve with [code]$AnimationTree.get("parameters/playback")[/code].
		[b]Example:[/b]
		[codeblock]
		var state_machine = $AnimationTree.get("parameters/playback")
		state_machine.travel("some_state")
		[/codeblock]

member.value:
Turn on auto advance when this condition is set. The provided name will become a boolean parameter on the [AnimationTree] that can be controlled from code (see [url=https://docs.godotengine.org/en/3.3/tutorials/animation/animation_tree.html#controlling-from-code][/url]). For example, if [member AnimationTree.tree_root] is an [AnimationNodeStateMachine] and [member advance_condition] is set to [code]"idle"[/code]:
			[codeblock]
			$animation_tree["parameters/conditions/idle"] = is_on_floor and (linear_velocity.x == 0)
			[/codeblock]

class.name: AnimationNodeStateMachine
class.brief_description: State machine for control of animations.
class.description:
Contains multiple nodes representing animation states, connected in a graph. Node transitions can be configured to happen automatically or via code, using a shortest-path algorithm. Retrieve the [AnimationNodeStateMachinePlayback] object from the [AnimationTree] node to control it programmatically.
		[b]Example:[/b]
		[codeblock]
		var state_machine = $AnimationTree.get("parameters/playback")
		state_machine.travel("some_state")
		[/codeblock]

class.brief_description: A time-scaling animation node to be used with [AnimationTree].
class.description: Allows scaling the speed of the animation (or reversing it) in any children nodes. Setting it to 0 will pause the animation.

class.name: AnimationNodeTimeSeek
class.brief_description: A time-seeking animation node to be used with [AnimationTree].
class.description:
This node can be used to cause a seek command to happen to any sub-children of the animation graph. Use this node type to play an [Animation] from the start or a certain playback position inside the [AnimationNodeBlendTree]. After setting the time and changing the animation playback, the seek node automatically goes into sleep mode on the next process frame by setting its [code]seek_position[/code] value to [code]-1.0[/code].
		[codeblock]
		# Play child animation from the start.
		animation_tree.set("parameters/Seek/seek_position", 0.0)
		# Alternative syntax (same result as above).
		animation_tree["parameters/Seek/seek_position"] = 0.0

		# Play child animation from 12 second timestamp.
		animation_tree.set("parameters/Seek/seek_position", 12.0)
		# Alternative syntax (same result as above).
		animation_tree["parameters/Seek/seek_position"] = 12.0
		[/codeblock]

member.value: The number of available input ports for this node.
member.name: input_count

member.value: Cross-fading time (in seconds) between each animation connected to the inputs.
member.name: xfade_time

class.name: AnimationNodeTransition
class.brief_description: A generic animation transition node for [AnimationTree].
class.description: Simple state machine for cases which don't require a more advanced [AnimationNodeStateMachine]. Animations can be connected to the inputs and transition times can be specified.

member.value: If [code]true[/code], filtering is enabled.
member.name: filter_enabled

method.name: add_input
method.description: Adds an input to the node. This is only useful for nodes created for use in an [AnimationNodeBlendTree].

method.name: blend_animation
method.description: Blend an animation by [code]blend[/code] amount (name must be valid in the linked [AnimationPlayer]). A [code]time[/code] and [code]delta[/code] may be passed, as well as whether [code]seek[/code] happened.

method.name: blend_input
method.description: Blend an input. This is only useful for nodes created for an [AnimationNodeBlendTree]. The [code]time[/code] parameter is a relative delta, unless [code]seek[/code] is [code]true[/code], in which case it is absolute. A filter mode may be optionally passed (see [enum FilterAction] for options).

method.name: blend_node
method.description: Blend another animation node (in case this node contains children animation nodes). This function is only useful if you inherit from [AnimationRootNode] instead, else editors will not display your node for addition.

method.name: get_caption
method.description: Gets the text caption for this node (used by some editors).

method.name: get_child_by_name
method.description: Gets a child node by index (used by editors inheriting from [AnimationRootNode]).

method.name: get_child_nodes
method.description: Gets all children nodes in order as a [code]name: node[/code] dictionary. Only useful when inheriting [AnimationRootNode].

method.name: get_input_count
method.description: Amount of inputs in this node, only useful for nodes that go into [AnimationNodeBlendTree].

method.name: get_input_name
method.description: Gets the name of an input by index.

method.name: get_parameter
method.description: Gets the value of a parameter. Parameters are custom local memory used for your nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees.

method.name: get_parameter_default_value
method.description: Gets the default value of a parameter. Parameters are custom local memory used for your nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees.

method.name: get_parameter_list
method.description: Gets the property information for parameter. Parameters are custom local memory used for your nodes, given a resource can be reused in multiple trees. Format is similar to [method Object.get_property_list].

method.name: has_filter
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] whether you want the blend tree editor to display filter editing on this node.

method.name: is_path_filtered
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] whether a given path is filtered.

method.name: process
method.description:
User-defined callback called when a custom node is processed. The [code]time[/code] parameter is a relative delta, unless [code]seek[/code] is [code]true[/code], in which case it is absolute.
				Here, call the [method blend_input], [method blend_node] or [method blend_animation] functions. You can also use [method get_parameter] and [method set_parameter] to modify local memory.
				This function should return the time left for the current animation to finish (if unsure, pass the value from the main blend being called).

method.name: remove_input
method.description: Removes an input, call this only when inactive.

method.name: set_filter_path
method.description: Adds or removes a path for the filter.

method.name: set_parameter
method.description: Sets a custom parameter. These are used as local storage, because resources can be reused across the tree or scenes.

class.name: AnimationNode

signal.name: removed_from_graph
signal.description: Called when the node was removed from the graph.

signal.name: tree_changed
signal.description: Emitted by nodes that inherit from this class and that have an internal tree when one of their nodes changes. The nodes that emit this signal are [AnimationNodeBlendSpace1D], [AnimationNodeBlendSpace2D], [AnimationNodeStateMachine], and [AnimationNodeBlendTree].

class.brief_description: Base resource for [AnimationTree] nodes.
class.description:
Base resource for [AnimationTree] nodes. In general, it's not used directly, but you can create custom ones with custom blending formulas.
	Inherit this when creating nodes mainly for use in [AnimationNodeBlendTree], otherwise [AnimationRootNode] should be used instead.

member.value: If playing, the current animation; otherwise, the animation last played. When set, would change the animation, but would not play it unless currently playing. See also [member current_animation].
member.name: assigned_animation

member.value: The name of the animation to play when the scene loads.
member.name: autoplay

member.value:
The name of the currently playing animation. If no animation is playing, the property's value is an empty string. Changing this value does not restart the animation. See [method play] for more information on playing animations.
			[b]Note[/b]: while this property appears in the inspector, it's not meant to be edited, and it's not saved in the scene. This property is mainly used to get the currently playing animation, and internally for animation playback tracks. For more information, see [Animation].
member.name: current_animation

member.value: The length (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.
member.name: current_animation_length

member.value: The position (in seconds) of the currently playing animation.
member.name: current_animation_position

member.value: The call mode to use for Call Method tracks.
member.name: method_call_mode

member.value: If [code]true[/code], updates animations in response to process-related notifications.
member.name: playback_active

member.value: The default time in which to blend animations. Ranges from 0 to 4096 with 0.01 precision.
member.name: playback_default_blend_time

member.value: The process notification in which to update animations.
member.name: playback_process_mode

member.value: The speed scaling ratio. For instance, if this value is 1, then the animation plays at normal speed. If it's 0.5, then it plays at half speed. If it's 2, then it plays at double speed.
member.name: playback_speed

member.value: The node from which node path references will travel.
member.name: root_node

method.name: add_animation
method.description: Adds [code]animation[/code] to the player accessible with the key [code]name[/code].

method.name: advance
method.description: Shifts position in the animation timeline and immediately updates the animation. [code]delta[/code] is the time in seconds to shift. Events between the current frame and [code]delta[/code] are handled.

method.name: animation_get_next
method.description: Returns the name of the next animation in the queue.

method.name: animation_set_next
method.description: Triggers the [code]anim_to[/code] animation when the [code]anim_from[/code] animation completes.

method.name: clear_caches
method.description: [AnimationPlayer] caches animated nodes. It may not notice if a node disappears; [method clear_caches] forces it to update the cache again.

method.name: clear_queue
method.description: Clears all queued, unplayed animations.

method.name: find_animation
method.description: Returns the name of [code]animation[/code] or an empty string if not found.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Returns the [Animation] with key [code]name[/code] or [code]null[/code] if not found.

method.name: get_animation_list
method.description: Returns the list of stored animation names.

method.name: get_blend_time
method.description: Gets the blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

method.name: get_playing_speed
method.description: Gets the actual playing speed of current animation or 0 if not playing. This speed is the [member playback_speed] property multiplied by [code]custom_speed[/code] argument specified when calling the [method play] method.

method.name: get_queue
method.description: Returns a list of the animation names that are currently queued to play.

method.name: has_animation
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [AnimationPlayer] stores an [Animation] with key [code]name[/code].

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if playing an animation.

method.name: play
method.description:
Plays the animation with key [code]name[/code]. Custom blend times and speed can be set. If [code]custom_speed[/code] is negative and [code]from_end[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation will play backwards (which is equivalent to calling [method play_backwards]).
				The [AnimationPlayer] keeps track of its current or last played animation with [member assigned_animation]. If this method is called with that same animation [code]name[/code], or with no [code]name[/code] parameter, the assigned animation will resume playing if it was paused, or restart if it was stopped (see [method stop] for both pause and stop). If the animation was already playing, it will keep playing.
				[b]Note:[/b] The animation will be updated the next time the [AnimationPlayer] is processed. If other variables are updated at the same time this is called, they may be updated too early. To perform the update immediately, call [code]advance(0)[/code].

method.name: play_backwards
method.description:
Plays the animation with key [code]name[/code] in reverse.
				This method is a shorthand for [method play] with [code]custom_speed = -1.0[/code] and [code]from_end = true[/code], so see its description for more information.

method.name: queue
method.description:
Queues an animation for playback once the current one is done.
				[b]Note:[/b] If a looped animation is currently playing, the queued animation will never play unless the looped animation is stopped somehow.

method.name: remove_animation
method.description: Removes the animation with key [code]name[/code].

method.name: rename_animation
method.description: Renames an existing animation with key [code]name[/code] to [code]newname[/code].

method.name: seek
method.description: Seeks the animation to the [code]seconds[/code] point in time (in seconds). If [code]update[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation updates too, otherwise it updates at process time. Events between the current frame and [code]seconds[/code] are skipped.

method.name: set_blend_time
method.description: Specifies a blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

method.name: stop
method.description:
Stops or pauses the currently playing animation. If [code]reset[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation position is reset to [code]0[/code] and the playback speed is reset to [code]1.0[/code].
				If [code]reset[/code] is [code]false[/code], the [member current_animation_position] will be kept and calling [method play] or [method play_backwards] without arguments or with the same animation name as [member assigned_animation] will resume the animation.

class.name: AnimationPlayer

signal.name: animation_changed
signal.description: If the currently being played animation changes, this signal will notify of such change.

signal.name: animation_finished
signal.description: Notifies when an animation finished playing.

signal.name: animation_started
signal.description: Notifies when an animation starts playing.

signal.name: caches_cleared
signal.description: Notifies when the caches have been cleared, either automatically, or manually via [method clear_caches].

class.brief_description: Container and player of [Animation] resources.
class.description:
An animation player is used for general-purpose playback of [Animation] resources. It contains a dictionary of animations (referenced by name) and custom blend times between their transitions. Additionally, animations can be played and blended in different channels.
		[AnimationPlayer] is more suited than [Tween] for animations where you know the final values in advance. For example, fading a screen in and out is more easily done with an [AnimationPlayer] node thanks to the animation tools provided by the editor. That particular example can also be implemented with a [Tween] node, but it requires doing everything by code.
		Updating the target properties of animations occurs at process time.

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the [AnimationTreePlayer] is able to play animations.
member.name: active

member.value:
The node from which to relatively access other nodes.
			It accesses the bones, so it should point to the same node the [AnimationPlayer] would point its Root Node at.
member.name: base_path

member.value:
The path to the [AnimationPlayer] from which this [AnimationTreePlayer] binds animations to animation nodes.
			Once set, [Animation] nodes can be added to the [AnimationTreePlayer].
member.name: master_player

member.value: The thread in which to update animations.
member.name: playback_process_mode

method.name: add_node
method.description: Adds a [code]type[/code] node to the graph with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: advance
method.description: Shifts position in the animation timeline. [code]delta[/code] is the time in seconds to shift. Events between the current frame and [code]delta[/code] are handled.

method.name: animation_node_get_animation
method.description: Returns the [AnimationPlayer]'s [Animation] bound to the [AnimationTreePlayer]'s animation node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: animation_node_get_master_animation
method.description: Returns the name of the [member master_player]'s [Animation] bound to this animation node.

method.name: animation_node_get_position
method.description: Returns the absolute playback timestamp of the animation node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: animation_node_set_animation
method.description: Binds a new [Animation] from the [member master_player] to the [AnimationTreePlayer]'s animation node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: animation_node_set_filter_path
method.description: If [code]enable[/code] is [code]true[/code], the animation node with ID [code]id[/code] turns off the track modifying the property at [code]path[/code]. The modified node's children continue to animate.

method.name: animation_node_set_master_animation
method.description: Binds the [Animation] named [code]source[/code] from [member master_player] to the animation node [code]id[/code]. Recalculates caches.

method.name: are_nodes_connected
method.description: Returns whether node [code]id[/code] and [code]dst_id[/code] are connected at the specified slot.

method.name: blend2_node_get_amount
method.description: Returns the blend amount of a Blend2 node given its name.

method.name: blend2_node_set_amount
method.description:
Sets the blend amount of a Blend2 node given its name and value.
				A Blend2 node blends two animations (A and B) with the amount between 0 and 1.
				At 0, output is input A. Towards 1, the influence of A gets lessened, the influence of B gets raised. At 1, output is input B.

method.name: blend2_node_set_filter_path
method.description: If [code]enable[/code] is [code]true[/code], the Blend2 node with name [code]id[/code] turns off the track modifying the property at [code]path[/code]. The modified node's children continue to animate.

method.name: blend3_node_get_amount
method.description: Returns the blend amount of a Blend3 node given its name.

method.name: blend3_node_set_amount
method.description:
Sets the blend amount of a Blend3 node given its name and value.
				A Blend3 Node blends three animations (A, B-, B+) with the amount between -1 and 1.
				At -1, output is input B-. From -1 to 0, the influence of B- gets lessened, the influence of A gets raised and the influence of B+ is 0. At 0, output is input A. From 0 to 1, the influence of A gets lessened, the influence of B+ gets raised and the influence of B+ is 0. At 1, output is input B+.

method.name: blend4_node_get_amount
method.description: Returns the blend amount of a Blend4 node given its name.

method.name: blend4_node_set_amount
method.description:
Sets the blend amount of a Blend4 node given its name and value.
				A Blend4 Node blends two pairs of animations.
				The two pairs are blended like Blend2 and then added together.

method.name: connect_nodes
method.description: Connects node [code]id[/code] to [code]dst_id[/code] at the specified input slot.

method.name: disconnect_nodes
method.description: Disconnects nodes connected to [code]id[/code] at the specified input slot.

method.name: get_node_list
method.description: Returns a [PoolStringArray] containing the name of all nodes.

method.name: mix_node_get_amount
method.description: Returns the mix amount of a Mix node given its name.

method.name: mix_node_set_amount
method.description:
Sets the mix amount of a Mix node given its name and value.
				A Mix node adds input b to input a by the amount given by ratio.

method.name: node_exists
method.description: Check if a node exists (by name).

method.name: node_get_input_count
method.description: Returns the input count for a given node. Different types of nodes have different amount of inputs.

method.name: node_get_input_source
method.description: Returns the input source for a given node input.

method.name: node_get_position
method.description: Returns position of a node in the graph given its name.

method.name: node_get_type
method.description: Gets the node type, will return from [enum NodeType] enum.

method.name: node_rename
method.description: Renames a node in the graph.

method.name: node_set_position
method.description: Sets the position of a node in the graph given its name and position.

method.name: oneshot_node_get_autorestart_delay
method.description: Returns the autostart delay of a OneShot node given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_get_autorestart_random_delay
method.description: Returns the autostart random delay of a OneShot node given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_get_fadein_time
method.description: Returns the fade in time of a OneShot node given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_get_fadeout_time
method.description: Returns the fade out time of a OneShot node given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_has_autorestart
method.description: Returns whether a OneShot node will auto restart given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_is_active
method.description: Returns whether a OneShot node is active given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_set_autorestart
method.description: Sets the autorestart property of a OneShot node given its name and value.

method.name: oneshot_node_set_autorestart_delay
method.description: Sets the autorestart delay of a OneShot node given its name and value in seconds.

method.name: oneshot_node_set_autorestart_random_delay
method.description: Sets the autorestart random delay of a OneShot node given its name and value in seconds.

method.name: oneshot_node_set_fadein_time
method.description: Sets the fade in time of a OneShot node given its name and value in seconds.

method.name: oneshot_node_set_fadeout_time
method.description: Sets the fade out time of a OneShot node given its name and value in seconds.

method.name: oneshot_node_set_filter_path
method.description: If [code]enable[/code] is [code]true[/code], the OneShot node with ID [code]id[/code] turns off the track modifying the property at [code]path[/code]. The modified node's children continue to animate.

method.name: oneshot_node_start
method.description: Starts a OneShot node given its name.

method.name: oneshot_node_stop
method.description: Stops the OneShot node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: recompute_caches
method.description: Manually recalculates the cache of track information generated from animation nodes. Needed when external sources modify the animation nodes' state.

method.name: remove_node
method.description: Removes the animation node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets this [AnimationTreePlayer].

method.name: timescale_node_get_scale
method.description: Returns the time scale value of the TimeScale node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: timescale_node_set_scale
method.description:
Sets the time scale of the TimeScale node with name [code]id[/code] to [code]scale[/code].
				The TimeScale node is used to speed [Animation]s up if the scale is above 1 or slow them down if it is below 1.
				If applied after a blend or mix, affects all input animations to that blend or mix.

method.name: timeseek_node_seek
method.description:
Sets the time seek value of the TimeSeek node with name [code]id[/code] to [code]seconds[/code].
				This functions as a seek in the [Animation] or the blend or mix of [Animation]s input in it.

method.name: transition_node_delete_input
method.description: Deletes the input at [code]input_idx[/code] for the transition node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: transition_node_get_current
method.description: Returns the index of the currently evaluated input for the transition node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: transition_node_get_input_count
method.description: Returns the number of inputs for the transition node with name [code]id[/code]. You can add inputs by right-clicking on the transition node.

method.name: transition_node_get_xfade_time
method.description: Returns the cross fade time for the transition node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: transition_node_has_input_auto_advance
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the input at [code]input_idx[/code] on the transition node with name [code]id[/code] is set to automatically advance to the next input upon completion.

method.name: transition_node_set_current
method.description: The transition node with name [code]id[/code] sets its current input at [code]input_idx[/code].

method.name: transition_node_set_input_auto_advance
method.description: The transition node with name [code]id[/code] advances to its next input automatically when the input at [code]input_idx[/code] completes.

method.name: transition_node_set_input_count
method.description: Resizes the number of inputs available for the transition node with name [code]id[/code].

method.name: transition_node_set_xfade_time
method.description: The transition node with name [code]id[/code] sets its cross fade time to [code]time_sec[/code].

class.name: AnimationTreePlayer
class.brief_description: [i]Deprecated.[/i] Animation player that uses a node graph for blending animations. Superseded by [AnimationTree].
class.description:
[i]Deprecated.[/i] A node graph tool for blending multiple animations bound to an [AnimationPlayer]. Especially useful for animating characters or other skeleton-based rigs. It can combine several animations to form a desired pose.
		It takes [Animation]s from an [AnimationPlayer] node and mixes them depending on the graph.
		See [AnimationTree] for a more full-featured replacement of this node.

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the [AnimationTree] will be processing.
member.name: active

member.value: The path to the [AnimationPlayer] used for animating.
member.name: anim_player

member.value: The process mode of this [AnimationTree]. See [enum AnimationProcessMode] for available modes.
member.name: process_mode

member.value:
The path to the Animation track used for root motion. Paths must be valid scene-tree paths to a node, and must be specified starting from the parent node of the node that will reproduce the animation. To specify a track that controls properties or bones, append its name after the path, separated by [code]":"[/code]. For example, [code]"character/skeleton:ankle"[/code] or [code]"character/mesh:transform/local"[/code].
			If the track has type [constant Animation.TYPE_TRANSFORM], the transformation will be cancelled visually, and the animation will appear to stay in place. See also [method get_root_motion_transform] and [RootMotionView].
member.name: root_motion_track

member.value: The root animation node of this [AnimationTree]. See [AnimationNode].
member.name: tree_root

method.name: advance
method.description: Manually advance the animations by the specified time (in seconds).

method.name: get_root_motion_transform
method.description: Retrieve the motion of the [member root_motion_track] as a [Transform] that can be used elsewhere. If [member root_motion_track] is not a path to a track of type [constant Animation.TYPE_TRANSFORM], returns an identity transformation. See also [member root_motion_track] and [RootMotionView].

class.name: AnimationTree
class.brief_description: A node to be used for advanced animation transitions in an [AnimationPlayer].
class.description: Note: When linked with an [AnimationPlayer], several properties and methods of the corresponding [AnimationPlayer] will not function as expected. Playback and transitions should be handled using only the [AnimationTree] and its constituent [AnimationNode](s). The [AnimationPlayer] node should be used solely for adding, deleting, and editing animations.

member.value:
The total length of the animation (in seconds).
			[b]Note:[/b] Length is not delimited by the last key, as this one may be before or after the end to ensure correct interpolation and looping.
member.name: length

member.value: A flag indicating that the animation must loop. This is used for correct interpolation of animation cycles, and for hinting the player that it must restart the animation.
member.name: loop

member.value: The animation step value.
member.name: step

method.name: add_track
method.description: Adds a track to the Animation.

method.name: animation_track_get_key_animation
method.description: Returns the animation name at the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Animation Track.

method.name: animation_track_insert_key
method.description: Inserts a key with value [code]animation[/code] at the given [code]time[/code] (in seconds). The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Animation Track.

method.name: animation_track_set_key_animation
method.description: Sets the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to value [code]animation[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Animation Track.

method.name: audio_track_get_key_end_offset
method.description:
Returns the end offset of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.
				End offset is the number of seconds cut off at the ending of the audio stream.

method.name: audio_track_get_key_start_offset
method.description:
Returns the start offset of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.
				Start offset is the number of seconds cut off at the beginning of the audio stream.

method.name: audio_track_get_key_stream
method.description: Returns the audio stream of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.

method.name: audio_track_insert_key
method.description:
Inserts an Audio Track key at the given [code]time[/code] in seconds. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.
				[code]stream[/code] is the [AudioStream] resource to play. [code]start_offset[/code] is the number of seconds cut off at the beginning of the audio stream, while [code]end_offset[/code] is at the ending.

method.name: audio_track_set_key_end_offset
method.description: Sets the end offset of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to value [code]offset[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.

method.name: audio_track_set_key_start_offset
method.description: Sets the start offset of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to value [code]offset[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.

method.name: audio_track_set_key_stream
method.description: Sets the stream of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to value [code]stream[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of an Audio Track.

method.name: bezier_track_get_key_in_handle
method.description: Returns the in handle of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: bezier_track_get_key_out_handle
method.description: Returns the out handle of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: bezier_track_get_key_value
method.description: Returns the value of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: bezier_track_insert_key
method.description:
Inserts a Bezier Track key at the given [code]time[/code] in seconds. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.
				[code]in_handle[/code] is the left-side weight of the added Bezier curve point, [code]out_handle[/code] is the right-side one, while [code]value[/code] is the actual value at this point.

method.name: bezier_track_interpolate
method.description: Returns the interpolated value at the given [code]time[/code] (in seconds). The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: bezier_track_set_key_in_handle
method.description: Sets the in handle of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to value [code]in_handle[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: bezier_track_set_key_out_handle
method.description: Sets the out handle of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to value [code]out_handle[/code]. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: bezier_track_set_key_value
method.description: Sets the value of the key identified by [code]key_idx[/code] to the given value. The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a Bezier Track.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the animation (clear all tracks and reset all).

method.name: copy_track
method.description: Adds a new track that is a copy of the given track from [code]to_animation[/code].

method.name: find_track
method.description: Returns the index of the specified track. If the track is not found, return -1.

method.name: get_track_count
method.description: Returns the amount of tracks in the animation.

method.name: method_track_get_key_indices
method.description: Returns all the key indices of a method track, given a position and delta time.

method.name: method_track_get_name
method.description: Returns the method name of a method track.

method.name: method_track_get_params
method.description: Returns the arguments values to be called on a method track for a given key in a given track.

method.name: remove_track
method.description: Removes a track by specifying the track index.

method.name: track_find_key
method.description: Finds the key index by time in a given track. Optionally, only find it if the exact time is given.

method.name: track_get_interpolation_loop_wrap
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the track at [code]idx[/code] wraps the interpolation loop. New tracks wrap the interpolation loop by default.

method.name: track_get_interpolation_type
method.description: Returns the interpolation type of a given track.

method.name: track_get_key_count
method.description: Returns the amount of keys in a given track.

method.name: track_get_key_time
method.description: Returns the time at which the key is located.

method.name: track_get_key_transition
method.description: Returns the transition curve (easing) for a specific key (see the built-in math function [method @GDScript.ease]).

method.name: track_get_key_value
method.description: Returns the value of a given key in a given track.

method.name: track_get_path
method.description: Gets the path of a track. For more information on the path format, see [method track_set_path].

method.name: track_get_type
method.description: Gets the type of a track.

method.name: track_insert_key
method.description: Insert a generic key in a given track.

method.name: track_is_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the track at index [code]idx[/code] is enabled.

method.name: track_is_imported
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the given track is imported. Else, return [code]false[/code].

method.name: track_move_down
method.description: Moves a track down.

method.name: track_move_to
method.description: Changes the index position of track [code]idx[/code] to the one defined in [code]to_idx[/code].

method.name: track_move_up
method.description: Moves a track up.

method.name: track_remove_key
method.description: Removes a key by index in a given track.

method.name: track_remove_key_at_position
method.description: Removes a key by position (seconds) in a given track.

method.name: track_set_enabled
method.description: Enables/disables the given track. Tracks are enabled by default.

method.name: track_set_imported
method.description: Sets the given track as imported or not.

method.name: track_set_interpolation_loop_wrap
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the track at [code]idx[/code] wraps the interpolation loop.

method.name: track_set_interpolation_type
method.description: Sets the interpolation type of a given track.

method.name: track_set_key_time
method.description: Sets the time of an existing key.

method.name: track_set_key_transition
method.description: Sets the transition curve (easing) for a specific key (see the built-in math function [method @GDScript.ease]).

method.name: track_set_key_value
method.description: Sets the value of an existing key.

method.name: track_set_path
method.description:
Sets the path of a track. Paths must be valid scene-tree paths to a node and must be specified starting from the parent node of the node that will reproduce the animation. Tracks that control properties or bones must append their name after the path, separated by [code]":"[/code].
				For example, [code]"character/skeleton:ankle"[/code] or [code]"character/mesh:transform/local"[/code].

method.name: track_swap
method.description: Swaps the track [code]idx[/code]'s index position with the track [code]with_idx[/code].

method.name: transform_track_insert_key
method.description: Insert a transform key for a transform track.

method.name: transform_track_interpolate
method.description: Returns the interpolated value of a transform track at a given time (in seconds). An array consisting of 3 elements: position ([Vector3]), rotation ([Quat]) and scale ([Vector3]).

method.name: value_track_get_key_indices
method.description: Returns all the key indices of a value track, given a position and delta time.

method.name: value_track_get_update_mode
method.description: Returns the update mode of a value track.

method.name: value_track_interpolate
method.description: Returns the interpolated value at the given time (in seconds). The [code]track_idx[/code] must be the index of a value track.

method.name: value_track_set_update_mode
method.description: Sets the update mode (see [enum UpdateMode]) of a value track.

class.name: Animation

signal.name: tracks_changed
signal.description: Emitted when there's a change in the list of tracks, e.g. tracks are added, moved or have changed paths.

class.brief_description: Contains data used to animate everything in the engine.
class.description:
An Animation resource contains data used to animate everything in the engine. Animations are divided into tracks, and each track must be linked to a node. The state of that node can be changed through time, by adding timed keys (events) to the track.
		[codeblock]
		# This creates an animation that makes the node "Enemy" move to the right by
		# 100 pixels in 0.5 seconds.
		var animation = Animation.new()
		var track_index = animation.add_track(Animation.TYPE_VALUE)
		animation.track_set_path(track_index, "Enemy:position:x")
		animation.track_insert_key(track_index, 0.0, 0)
		animation.track_insert_key(track_index, 0.5, 100)
		[/codeblock]
		Animations are just data containers, and must be added to nodes such as an [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimationTreePlayer] to be played back. Animation tracks have different types, each with its own set of dedicated methods. Check [enum TrackType] to see available types.

member.value:
The rate at which objects stop spinning in this area. Represents the angular velocity lost per second.
			See [member ProjectSettings.physics/2d/default_angular_damp] for more details about damping.

member.name: audio_bus_name

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the area's audio bus overrides the default audio bus.
member.name: audio_bus_override

member.value: The area's physics layer(s). Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layers that object A scans. See also [member collision_mask]. See [url=https://docs.godotengine.org/en/3.3/tutorials/physics/physics_introduction.html#collision-layers-and-masks]Collision layers and masks[/url] in the documentation for more information.

member.name: collision_mask

member.value: The area's gravity intensity (in pixels per second squared). This value multiplies the gravity vector. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction.
member.name: gravity

member.value: The falloff factor for point gravity. The greater the value, the faster gravity decreases with distance.
member.name: gravity_distance_scale

member.value: If [code]true[/code], gravity is calculated from a point (set via [member gravity_vec]). See also [member space_override].
member.name: gravity_point

The rate at which objects stop moving in this area. Represents the linear velocity lost per second.
			See [member ProjectSettings.physics/2d/default_linear_damp] for more details about damping.

method.name: get_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the layer mask. Describes whether other areas will collide with this one on the given layer.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask. Describes whether this area will collide with others on the given layer.

method.name: get_overlapping_areas
method.description: Returns a list of intersecting [Area2D]s. For performance reasons (collisions are all processed at the same time) this list is modified once during the physics step, not immediately after objects are moved. Consider using signals instead.

method.name: get_overlapping_bodies
method.description: Returns a list of intersecting [PhysicsBody2D]s. For performance reasons (collisions are all processed at the same time) this list is modified once during the physics step, not immediately after objects are moved. Consider using signals instead.

method.name: overlaps_area
method.description:
If [code]true[/code], the given area overlaps the Area2D.
				[b]Note:[/b] The result of this test is not immediate after moving objects. For performance, the list of overlaps is updated once per frame and before the physics step. Consider using signals instead.

method.name: overlaps_body
method.description:
If [code]true[/code], the given physics body overlaps the Area2D.
				[b]Note:[/b] The result of this test is not immediate after moving objects. For performance, list of overlaps is updated once per frame and before the physics step. Consider using signals instead.
				The [code]body[/code] argument can either be a [PhysicsBody2D] or a [TileMap] instance (while TileMaps are not physics bodies themselves, they register their tiles with collision shapes as a virtual physics body).

method.name: set_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting an area in/out of only one layer easier.

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.
