method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [code]property[/code] is disabled in the class specified by [code]class_name[/code]. When a property is disabled, it won't appear in the inspector when selecting a node that extends the class specified by [code]class_name[/code].

method.name: is_feature_disabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [code]feature[/code] is disabled. When a feature is disabled, it will disappear from the editor entirely.

method.name: load_from_file
method.description: Loads an editor feature profile from a file. The file must follow the JSON format obtained by using the feature profile manager's [b]Export[/b] button or the [method save_to_file] method.

method.name: save_to_file
method.description: Saves the editor feature profile to a file in JSON format. It can then be imported using the feature profile manager's [b]Import[/b] button or the [method load_from_file] button.

method.name: set_disable_class
method.description: If [code]disable[/code] is [code]true[/code], disables the class specified by [code]class_name[/code]. When disabled, the class won't appear in the Create New Node dialog.

method.name: set_disable_class_editor
method.description: If [code]disable[/code] is [code]true[/code], disables editing for the class specified by [code]class_name[/code]. When disabled, the class will still appear in the Create New Node dialog but the inspector will be read-only when selecting a node that extends the class.

method.name: set_disable_class_property
method.description: If [code]disable[/code] is [code]true[/code], disables editing for [code]property[/code] in the class specified by [code]class_name[/code]. When a property is disabled, it won't appear in the inspector when selecting a node that extends the class specified by [code]class_name[/code].

method.name: set_disable_feature
method.description: If [code]disable[/code] is [code]true[/code], disables the editor feature specified in [code]feature[/code]. When a feature is disabled, it will disappear from the editor entirely.

class.name: EditorFeatureProfile
class.brief_description: An editor feature profile which can be used to disable specific features.
class.description:
An editor feature profile can be used to disable specific features of the Godot editor. When disabled, the features won't appear in the editor, which makes the editor less cluttered. This is useful in education settings to reduce confusion or when working in a team. For example, artists and level designers could use a feature profile that disables the script editor to avoid accidentally making changes to files they aren't supposed to edit.
		To manage editor feature profiles visually, use [b]Editor > Manage Feature Profiles...[/b] at the top of the editor window.

member.value: The location from which the user may select a file, including [code]res://[/code], [code]user://[/code], and the local file system.
member.name: access

member.value: The currently occupied directory.
member.name: current_dir

member.value: The currently selected file.
member.name: current_file

member.value: The file system path in the address bar.
member.name: current_path

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the [EditorFileDialog] will not warn the user before overwriting files.
member.name: disable_overwrite_warning

member.value: The view format in which the [EditorFileDialog] displays resources to the user.
member.name: display_mode

member.value: The purpose of the [EditorFileDialog], which defines the allowed behaviors.
member.name: mode

member.value: If [code]true[/code], hidden files and directories will be visible in the [EditorFileDialog].
member.name: show_hidden_files

method.name: add_filter
method.description:
Adds a comma-delimited file extension filter option to the [EditorFileDialog] with an optional semi-colon-delimited label.
				For example, [code]"*.tscn, *.scn; Scenes"[/code] results in filter text "Scenes (*.tscn, *.scn)".

method.name: clear_filters
method.description: Removes all filters except for "All Files (*)".

method.name: get_vbox
method.description: Returns the [code]VBoxContainer[/code] used to display the file system.

method.name: invalidate
method.description: Notify the [EditorFileDialog] that its view of the data is no longer accurate. Updates the view contents on next view update.

class.name: EditorFileDialog

signal.name: dir_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a directory is selected.

signal.name: file_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a file is selected.

signal.name: files_selected
signal.description: Emitted when multiple files are selected.

class.brief_description: A modified version of [FileDialog] used by the editor.

method.name: find_dir_index
method.description: Returns the index of the directory with name [code]name[/code] or [code]-1[/code] if not found.

method.name: find_file_index
method.description: Returns the index of the file with name [code]name[/code] or [code]-1[/code] if not found.

method.name: get_file
method.description: Returns the name of the file at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: get_file_count
method.description: Returns the number of files in this directory.

method.name: get_file_import_is_valid
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file at index [code]idx[/code] imported properly.

method.name: get_file_path
method.description: Returns the path to the file at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: get_file_script_class_extends
method.description: Returns the base class of the script class defined in the file at index [code]idx[/code]. If the file doesn't define a script class using the [code]class_name[/code] syntax, this will return an empty string.

method.name: get_file_script_class_name
method.description: Returns the name of the script class defined in the file at index [code]idx[/code]. If the file doesn't define a script class using the [code]class_name[/code] syntax, this will return an empty string.

method.name: get_file_type
method.description: Returns the resource type of the file at index [code]idx[/code]. This returns a string such as [code]"Resource"[/code] or [code]"GDScript"[/code], [i]not[/i] a file extension such as [code]".gd"[/code].

method.name: get_name
method.description: Returns the name of this directory.

method.name: get_parent
method.description: Returns the parent directory for this directory or [code]null[/code] if called on a directory at [code]res://[/code] or [code]user://[/code].

method.name: get_path
method.description: Returns the path to this directory.

method.name: get_subdir
method.description: Returns the subdirectory at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: get_subdir_count
method.description: Returns the number of subdirectories in this directory.

class.name: EditorFileSystemDirectory
class.brief_description: A directory for the resource filesystem.
class.description: A more generalized, low-level variation of the directory concept.

method.name: get_file_type
method.description: Returns the resource type of the file, given the full path. This returns a string such as [code]"Resource"[/code] or [code]"GDScript"[/code], [i]not[/i] a file extension such as [code]".gd"[/code].

method.name: get_filesystem
method.description: Gets the root directory object.

method.name: get_filesystem_path
method.description: Returns a view into the filesystem at [code]path[/code].

method.name: get_scanning_progress
method.description: Returns the scan progress for 0 to 1 if the FS is being scanned.

method.name: is_scanning
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] of the filesystem is being scanned.

method.name: scan
method.description: Scan the filesystem for changes.

method.name: scan_sources
method.description: Check if the source of any imported resource changed.

method.name: update_file
method.description: Update a file information. Call this if an external program (not Godot) modified the file.

method.name: update_script_classes
method.description: Scans the script files and updates the list of custom class names.

class.name: EditorFileSystem

signal.name: filesystem_changed
signal.description: Emitted if the filesystem changed.

signal.name: resources_reimported
signal.description: Emitted if a resource is reimported.

signal.name: resources_reload
signal.description: Emitted if at least one resource is reloaded when the filesystem is scanned.

signal.name: sources_changed
signal.description: Emitted if the source of any imported file changed.

class.brief_description: Resource filesystem, as the editor sees it.
class.description:
This object holds information of all resources in the filesystem, their types, etc.
		[b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorInterface.get_resource_filesystem].

method.name: get_import_options
method.description: Gets the options and default values for the preset at this index. Returns an Array of Dictionaries with the following keys: [code]name[/code], [code]default_value[/code], [code]property_hint[/code] (optional), [code]hint_string[/code] (optional), [code]usage[/code] (optional).

method.name: get_import_order
method.description: Gets the order of this importer to be run when importing resources. Higher values will be called later. Use this to ensure the importer runs after the dependencies are already imported.

method.name: get_importer_name
method.description: Gets the unique name of the importer.

method.name: get_option_visibility
method.description:
This method can be overridden to hide specific import options if conditions are met. This is mainly useful for hiding options that depend on others if one of them is disabled. For example:
				[codeblock]
				func get_option_visibility(option, options):
				    # Only show the lossy quality setting if the compression mode is set to "Lossy".
				    if option == "compress/lossy_quality" and options.has("compress/mode"):
				        return int(options["compress/mode"]) == COMPRESS_LOSSY

				    return true
				[/codeblock]
				Return [code]true[/code] to make all options always visible.

method.name: get_preset_count
method.description: Gets the number of initial presets defined by the plugin. Use [method get_import_options] to get the default options for the preset and [method get_preset_name] to get the name of the preset.

method.name: get_preset_name
method.description: Gets the name of the options preset at this index.

method.name: get_priority
method.description: Gets the priority of this plugin for the recognized extension. Higher priority plugins will be preferred. The default priority is [code]1.0[/code].

method.name: get_recognized_extensions
method.description: Gets the list of file extensions to associate with this loader (case-insensitive). e.g. [code]["obj"][/code].

method.name: get_resource_type
method.description: Gets the Godot resource type associated with this loader. e.g. [code]"Mesh"[/code] or [code]"Animation"[/code].

method.name: get_save_extension
method.description: Gets the extension used to save this resource in the [code].import[/code] directory.

method.name: get_visible_name
method.description: Gets the name to display in the import window. You should choose this name as a continuation to "Import as", e.g. "Import as Special Mesh".

method.name: import
method.description:
Imports [code]source_file[/code] into [code]save_path[/code] with the import [code]options[/code] specified. The [code]platform_variants[/code] and [code]gen_files[/code] arrays will be modified by this function.
				This method must be overridden to do the actual importing work. See this class' description for an example of overriding this method.

class.name: EditorImportPlugin
class.brief_description: Registers a custom resource importer in the editor. Use the class to parse any file and import it as a new resource type.

method.name: add_custom_control
method.description: Adds a custom control, which is not necessarily a property editor.

method.name: add_property_editor
method.description: Adds a property editor for an individual property. The [code]editor[/code] control must extend [EditorProperty].

method.name: add_property_editor_for_multiple_properties
method.description: Adds an editor that allows modifying multiple properties. The [code]editor[/code] control must extend [EditorProperty].

method.name: can_handle
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this object can be handled by this plugin.

method.name: parse_begin
method.description: Called to allow adding controls at the beginning of the list.

method.name: parse_category
method.description: Called to allow adding controls at the beginning of the category.

method.name: parse_end
method.description: Called to allow adding controls at the end of the list.

method.name: parse_property
method.description: Called to allow adding property specific editors to the inspector. Usually these inherit [EditorProperty]. Returning [code]true[/code] removes the built-in editor for this property, otherwise allows to insert a custom editor before the built-in one.

class.name: EditorInspectorPlugin
class.brief_description: Plugin for adding custom property editors on inspector.
class.description:
These plugins allow adding custom property editors to [EditorInspector].
		Plugins are registered via [method EditorPlugin.add_inspector_plugin].
		When an object is edited, the [method can_handle] function is called and must return [code]true[/code] if the object type is supported.
		If supported, the function [method parse_begin] will be called, allowing to place custom controls at the beginning of the class.
		Subsequently, the [method parse_category] and [method parse_property] are called for every category and property. They offer the ability to add custom controls to the inspector too.
		Finally, [method parse_end] will be called.
		On each of these calls, the "add" functions can be called.

method.name: refresh
method.description:
Refreshes the inspector.
				[b]Note:[/b] To save on CPU resources, calling this method will do nothing if the time specified in [code]docks/property_editor/auto_refresh_interval[/code] editor setting hasn't passed yet since this method was last called. (By default, this interval is set to 0.3 seconds.)

class.name: EditorInspector

signal.name: object_id_selected
signal.description: Emitted when the Edit button of an [Object] has been pressed in the inspector. This is mainly used in the remote scene tree inspector.

signal.name: property_edited
signal.description: Emitted when a property is edited in the inspector.

signal.name: property_keyed
signal.description: Emitted when a property is keyed in the inspector. Properties can be keyed by clicking the "key" icon next to a property when the Animation panel is toggled.

signal.name: property_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a property is selected in the inspector.

signal.name: property_toggled
signal.description:
Emitted when a boolean property is toggled in the inspector.
				[b]Note:[/b] This signal is never emitted if the internal [code]autoclear[/code] property enabled. Since this property is always enabled in the editor inspector, this signal is never emitted by the editor itself.

signal.name: resource_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a resource is selected in the inspector.

signal.name: restart_requested
signal.description: Emitted when a property that requires a restart to be applied is edited in the inspector. This is only used in the Project Settings and Editor Settings.

class.brief_description: A tab used to edit properties of the selected node.
class.description:
The editor inspector is by default located on the right-hand side of the editor. It's used to edit the properties of the selected node. For example, you can select a node such as [Sprite] then edit its transform through the inspector tool. The editor inspector is an essential tool in the game development workflow.
		[b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorInterface.get_inspector].

member.value: If [code]true[/code], enables distraction-free mode which hides side docks to increase the space available for the main view.
member.name: distraction_free_mode

method.name: edit_node
method.description: Edits the given [Node]. The node will be also selected if it's inside the scene tree.

method.name: edit_resource
method.description: Edits the given [Resource].

method.name: get_base_control
method.description: Returns the main container of Godot editor's window. For example, you can use it to retrieve the size of the container and place your controls accordingly.

method.name: get_current_path
method.description: Returns the current path being viewed in the [FileSystemDock].

method.name: get_edited_scene_root
method.description: Returns the edited (current) scene's root [Node].

method.name: get_editor_scale
method.description:
Returns the actual scale of the editor UI ([code]1.0[/code] being 100% scale). This can be used to adjust position and dimensions of the UI added by plugins.
				[b]Note:[/b] This value is set via the [code]interface/editor/display_scale[/code] and [code]interface/editor/custom_display_scale[/code] editor settings. Editor must be restarted for changes to be properly applied.

method.name: get_editor_settings
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorSettings] instance.

method.name: get_editor_viewport
method.description:
Returns the main editor control. Use this as a parent for main screens.
				[b]Note:[/b] This returns the main editor control containing the whole editor, not the 2D or 3D viewports specifically.

method.name: get_file_system_dock
method.description: Returns the editor's [FileSystemDock] instance.

method.name: get_inspector
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorInspector] instance.

method.name: get_open_scenes
method.description: Returns an [Array] with the file paths of the currently opened scenes.

method.name: get_playing_scene
method.description: Returns the name of the scene that is being played. If no scene is currently being played, returns an empty string.

method.name: get_resource_filesystem
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorFileSystem] instance.

method.name: get_resource_previewer
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorResourcePreview] instance.

method.name: get_script_editor
method.description: Returns the editor's [ScriptEditor] instance.

method.name: get_selected_path
method.description: Returns the path of the directory currently selected in the [FileSystemDock]. If a file is selected, its base directory will be returned using [method String.get_base_dir] instead.

method.name: get_selection
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorSelection] instance.

method.name: inspect_object
method.description: Shows the given property on the given [code]object[/code] in the editor's Inspector dock. If [code]inspector_only[/code] is [code]true[/code], plugins will not attempt to edit [code]object[/code].

method.name: is_playing_scene
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if a scene is currently being played, [code]false[/code] otherwise. Paused scenes are considered as being played.

method.name: is_plugin_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified [code]plugin[/code] is enabled. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

method.name: make_mesh_previews
method.description: Returns mesh previews rendered at the given size as an [Array] of [Texture]s.

method.name: open_scene_from_path
method.description: Opens the scene at the given path.

method.name: play_current_scene
method.description: Plays the currently active scene.

method.name: play_custom_scene
method.description: Plays the scene specified by its filepath.

method.name: play_main_scene
method.description: Plays the main scene.

method.name: reload_scene_from_path
method.description: Reloads the scene at the given path.

method.name: save_scene
method.description: Saves the scene. Returns either [code]OK[/code] or [code]ERR_CANT_CREATE[/code] (see [@GlobalScope] constants).

method.name: save_scene_as
method.description: Saves the scene as a file at [code]path[/code].

method.name: select_file
method.description: Selects the file, with the path provided by [code]file[/code], in the FileSystem dock.

method.name: set_main_screen_editor
method.description: Sets the editor's current main screen to the one specified in [code]name[/code]. [code]name[/code] must match the text of the tab in question exactly ([code]2D[/code], [code]3D[/code], [code]Script[/code], [code]AssetLib[/code]).

method.name: set_plugin_enabled
method.description: Sets the enabled status of a plugin. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

method.name: stop_playing_scene
method.description: Stops the scene that is currently playing.

class.name: EditorInterface
class.brief_description: Godot editor's interface.
class.description:
EditorInterface gives you control over Godot editor's window. It allows customizing the window, saving and (re-)loading scenes, rendering mesh previews, inspecting and editing resources and objects, and provides access to [EditorSettings], [EditorFileSystem], [EditorResourcePreview], [ScriptEditor], the editor viewport, and information about scenes.
		[b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorPlugin.get_editor_interface].

method.name: add_autoload_singleton
method.description: Adds a script at [code]path[/code] to the Autoload list as [code]name[/code].

method.name: add_control_to_bottom_panel
method.description: Adds a control to the bottom panel (together with Output, Debug, Animation, etc). Returns a reference to the button added. It's up to you to hide/show the button when needed. When your plugin is deactivated, make sure to remove your custom control with [method remove_control_from_bottom_panel] and free it with [method Node.queue_free].

method.name: add_control_to_container
method.description:
Adds a custom control to a container (see [enum CustomControlContainer]). There are many locations where custom controls can be added in the editor UI.
				Please remember that you have to manage the visibility of your custom controls yourself (and likely hide it after adding it).
				When your plugin is deactivated, make sure to remove your custom control with [method remove_control_from_container] and free it with [method Node.queue_free].

method.name: add_control_to_dock
method.description:
Adds the control to a specific dock slot (see [enum DockSlot] for options).
				If the dock is repositioned and as long as the plugin is active, the editor will save the dock position on further sessions.
				When your plugin is deactivated, make sure to remove your custom control with [method remove_control_from_docks] and free it with [method Node.queue_free].

method.name: add_custom_type
method.description:
Adds a custom type, which will appear in the list of nodes or resources. An icon can be optionally passed.
				When given node or resource is selected, the base type will be instanced (ie, "Spatial", "Control", "Resource"), then the script will be loaded and set to this object.
				You can use the virtual method [method handles] to check if your custom object is being edited by checking the script or using the [code]is[/code] keyword.
				During run-time, this will be a simple object with a script so this function does not need to be called then.

method.name: add_export_plugin
method.description:
Registers a new [EditorExportPlugin]. Export plugins are used to perform tasks when the project is being exported.
				See [method add_inspector_plugin] for an example of how to register a plugin.

method.name: add_import_plugin
method.description:
Registers a new [EditorImportPlugin]. Import plugins are used to import custom and unsupported assets as a custom [Resource] type.
				[b]Note:[/b] If you want to import custom 3D asset formats use [method add_scene_import_plugin] instead.
				See [method add_inspector_plugin] for an example of how to register a plugin.

method.name: add_inspector_plugin
add_scene_import_plugin
method.description: Registers a new [EditorSceneImporter]. Scene importers are used to import custom 3D asset formats as scenes.

method.name: add_spatial_gizmo_plugin
method.description:
Registers a new [EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin]. Gizmo plugins are used to add custom gizmos to the 3D preview viewport for a [Spatial].
				See [method add_inspector_plugin] for an example of how to register a plugin.

method.name: add_tool_menu_item
method.description: Adds a custom menu item to [b]Project > Tools[/b] as [code]name[/code] that calls [code]callback[/code] on an instance of [code]handler[/code] with a parameter [code]ud[/code] when user activates it.

method.name: add_tool_submenu_item
method.description: Adds a custom submenu under [b]Project > Tools >[/b] [code]name[/code]. [code]submenu[/code] should be an object of class [PopupMenu]. This submenu should be cleaned up using [code]remove_tool_menu_item(name)[/code].

method.name: apply_changes
method.description:
This method is called when the editor is about to save the project, switch to another tab, etc. It asks the plugin to apply any pending state changes to ensure consistency.
				This is used, for example, in shader editors to let the plugin know that it must apply the shader code being written by the user to the object.

method.name: build
method.description:
This method is called when the editor is about to run the project. The plugin can then perform required operations before the project runs.
				This method must return a boolean. If this method returns [code]false[/code], the project will not run. The run is aborted immediately, so this also prevents all other plugins' [method build] methods from running.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the state and reset the object being edited to zero. This ensures your plugin does not keep editing a currently existing node, or a node from the wrong scene.

method.name: disable_plugin
method.description: Called by the engine when the user disables the [EditorPlugin] in the Plugin tab of the project settings window.

method.name: edit
method.description: This function is used for plugins that edit specific object types (nodes or resources). It requests the editor to edit the given object.

method.name: enable_plugin
method.description: Called by the engine when the user enables the [EditorPlugin] in the Plugin tab of the project settings window.

method.name: forward_canvas_draw_over_viewport
method.description:
Called by the engine when the 2D editor's viewport is updated. Use the [code]overlay[/code] [Control] for drawing. You can update the viewport manually by calling [method update_overlays].
				[codeblock]
				func forward_canvas_draw_over_viewport(overlay):
				    # Draw a circle at cursor position.
				    overlay.draw_circle(overlay.get_local_mouse_position(), 64, Color.white)

				func forward_canvas_gui_input(event):
				    if event is InputEventMouseMotion:
				        # Redraw viewport when cursor is moved.
				        update_overlays()
				        return true
				    return false
				[/codeblock]

method.name: forward_canvas_force_draw_over_viewport
method.description:
This method is the same as [method forward_canvas_draw_over_viewport], except it draws on top of everything. Useful when you need an extra layer that shows over anything else.
				You need to enable calling of this method by using [method set_force_draw_over_forwarding_enabled].

method.name: forward_canvas_gui_input
method.description:
Called when there is a root node in the current edited scene, [method handles] is implemented and an [InputEvent] happens in the 2D viewport. Intercepts the [InputEvent], if [code]return true[/code] [EditorPlugin] consumes the [code]event[/code], otherwise forwards [code]event[/code] to other Editor classes. Example:
				[codeblock]
				# Prevents the InputEvent to reach other Editor classes
				func forward_canvas_gui_input(event):
				    var forward = true
				    return forward
				[/codeblock]
				Must [code]return false[/code] in order to forward the [InputEvent] to other Editor classes. Example:
				[codeblock]
				# Consumes InputEventMouseMotion and forwards other InputEvent types
				func forward_canvas_gui_input(event):
				    var forward = false
				    if event is InputEventMouseMotion:
				        forward = true
				    return forward
				[/codeblock]

method.name: forward_spatial_draw_over_viewport
method.description:
Called by the engine when the 3D editor's viewport is updated. Use the [code]overlay[/code] [Control] for drawing. You can update the viewport manually by calling [method update_overlays].
				[codeblock]
				func forward_spatial_draw_over_viewport(overlay):
				    # Draw a circle at cursor position.
				    overlay.draw_circle(overlay.get_local_mouse_position(), 64)

				func forward_spatial_gui_input(camera, event):
				    if event is InputEventMouseMotion:
				        # Redraw viewport when cursor is moved.
				        update_overlays()
				        return true
				    return false
				[/codeblock]

method.name: forward_spatial_force_draw_over_viewport
method.description:
This method is the same as [method forward_spatial_draw_over_viewport], except it draws on top of everything. Useful when you need an extra layer that shows over anything else.
				You need to enable calling of this method by using [method set_force_draw_over_forwarding_enabled].

method.name: forward_spatial_gui_input
method.description:
Called when there is a root node in the current edited scene, [method handles] is implemented and an [InputEvent] happens in the 3D viewport. Intercepts the [InputEvent], if [code]return true[/code] [EditorPlugin] consumes the [code]event[/code], otherwise forwards [code]event[/code] to other Editor classes. Example:
				[codeblock]
				# Prevents the InputEvent to reach other Editor classes
				func forward_spatial_gui_input(camera, event):
				    var forward = true
				    return forward
				[/codeblock]
				Must [code]return false[/code] in order to forward the [InputEvent] to other Editor classes. Example:
				[codeblock]
				# Consumes InputEventMouseMotion and forwards other InputEvent types
				func forward_spatial_gui_input(camera, event):
				    var forward = false
				    if event is InputEventMouseMotion:
				        forward = true
				    return forward
				[/codeblock]

method.name: get_breakpoints
method.description: This is for editors that edit script-based objects. You can return a list of breakpoints in the format ([code]script:line[/code]), for example: [code]res://path_to_script.gd:25[/code].

method.name: get_editor_interface
method.description: Returns the [EditorInterface] object that gives you control over Godot editor's window and its functionalities.

method.name: get_plugin_icon
get_plugin_name
method.description:
Override this method in your plugin to provide the name of the plugin when displayed in the Godot editor.
				For main screen plugins, this appears at the top of the screen, to the right of the "2D", "3D", "Script", and "AssetLib" buttons.

method.name: get_script_create_dialog
method.description:
Gets the Editor's dialogue used for making scripts.
				[b]Note:[/b] Users can configure it before use.

method.name: get_state
method.description: Gets the state of your plugin editor. This is used when saving the scene (so state is kept when opening it again) and for switching tabs (so state can be restored when the tab returns).

method.name: get_undo_redo
method.description: Gets the undo/redo object. Most actions in the editor can be undoable, so use this object to make sure this happens when it's worth it.

method.name: get_window_layout
method.description: Gets the GUI layout of the plugin. This is used to save the project's editor layout when [method queue_save_layout] is called or the editor layout was changed(For example changing the position of a dock).

method.name: handles
method.description: Implement this function if your plugin edits a specific type of object (Resource or Node). If you return [code]true[/code], then you will get the functions [method edit] and [method make_visible] called when the editor requests them. If you have declared the methods [method forward_canvas_gui_input] and [method forward_spatial_gui_input] these will be called too.

method.name: has_main_screen
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this is a main screen editor plugin (it goes in the workspace selector together with [b]2D[/b], [b]3D[/b], [b]Script[/b] and [b]AssetLib[/b]).

method.name: hide_bottom_panel
method.description: Minimizes the bottom panel.

method.name: make_bottom_panel_item_visible
method.description: Makes a specific item in the bottom panel visible.

method.name: make_visible
method.description:
This function will be called when the editor is requested to become visible. It is used for plugins that edit a specific object type.
				Remember that you have to manage the visibility of all your editor controls manually.

method.name: queue_save_layout
method.description: Queue save the project's editor layout.

method.name: remove_autoload_singleton
method.description: Removes an Autoload [code]name[/code] from the list.

method.name: remove_control_from_bottom_panel
method.description: Removes the control from the bottom panel. You have to manually [method Node.queue_free] the control.

method.name: remove_control_from_container
method.description: Removes the control from the specified container. You have to manually [method Node.queue_free] the control.

method.name: remove_control_from_docks
method.description: Removes the control from the dock. You have to manually [method Node.queue_free] the control.

method.name: remove_custom_type
method.description: Removes a custom type added by [method add_custom_type].

method.name: remove_export_plugin
method.description: Removes an export plugin registered by [method add_export_plugin].

method.name: remove_import_plugin
method.description: Removes an import plugin registered by [method add_import_plugin].

method.name: remove_inspector_plugin
method.description: Removes an inspector plugin registered by [method add_import_plugin]

method.name: remove_scene_import_plugin
method.description: Removes a scene importer registered by [method add_scene_import_plugin].

method.name: remove_spatial_gizmo_plugin
method.description: Removes a gizmo plugin registered by [method add_spatial_gizmo_plugin].

method.name: remove_tool_menu_item
method.description: Removes a menu [code]name[/code] from [b]Project > Tools[/b].

method.name: save_external_data
method.description: This method is called after the editor saves the project or when it's closed. It asks the plugin to save edited external scenes/resources.

method.name: set_force_draw_over_forwarding_enabled
method.description: Enables calling of [method forward_canvas_force_draw_over_viewport] for the 2D editor and [method forward_spatial_force_draw_over_viewport] for the 3D editor when their viewports are updated. You need to call this method only once and it will work permanently for this plugin.

method.name: set_input_event_forwarding_always_enabled
method.description: Use this method if you always want to receive inputs from 3D view screen inside [method forward_spatial_gui_input]. It might be especially usable if your plugin will want to use raycast in the scene.

method.name: set_state
method.description: Restore the state saved by [method get_state].

method.name: set_window_layout
method.description: Restore the plugin GUI layout saved by [method get_window_layout].

method.name: update_overlays
method.description: Updates the overlays of the 2D and 3D editor viewport. Causes methods [method forward_canvas_draw_over_viewport], [method forward_canvas_force_draw_over_viewport], [method forward_spatial_draw_over_viewport] and [method forward_spatial_force_draw_over_viewport] to be called.

class.name: EditorPlugin

signal.name: main_screen_changed
signal.description: Emitted when user changes the workspace ([b]2D[/b], [b]3D[/b], [b]Script[/b], [b]AssetLib[/b]). Also works with custom screens defined by plugins.

signal.name: scene_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the scene is changed in the editor. The argument will return the root node of the scene that has just become active. If this scene is new and empty, the argument will be [code]null[/code].

signal.name: scene_closed
signal.description: Emitted when user closes a scene. The argument is file path to a closed scene.

class.brief_description: Used by the editor to extend its functionality.
class.description: Plugins are used by the editor to extend functionality. The most common types of plugins are those which edit a given node or resource type, import plugins and export plugins. See also [EditorScript] to add functions to the editor.

member.value: Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property is checkable.
member.name: checkable

member.value: Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property is checked.
member.name: checked

member.value: Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property must draw with error color. This is used for editable children's properties.
member.name: draw_red

member.value: Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property can add keys for animation.
member.name: keying

member.value: Set this property to change the label (if you want to show one).
member.name: label

member.value: Used by the inspector, set to [code]true[/code] when the property is read-only.
member.name: read_only

method.name: add_focusable
method.description: If any of the controls added can gain keyboard focus, add it here. This ensures that focus will be restored if the inspector is refreshed.

method.name: emit_changed
method.description: If one or several properties have changed, this must be called. [code]field[/code] is used in case your editor can modify fields separately (as an example, Vector3.x). The [code]changing[/code] argument avoids the editor requesting this property to be refreshed (leave as [code]false[/code] if unsure).

method.name: get_edited_object
method.description: Gets the edited object.

method.name: get_edited_property
method.description: Gets the edited property. If your editor is for a single property (added via [method EditorInspectorPlugin.parse_property]), then this will return the property.

method.name: get_tooltip_text
method.description: Must be implemented to provide a custom tooltip to the property editor.

method.name: set_bottom_editor
method.description: Puts the [code]editor[/code] control below the property label. The control must be previously added using [method Node.add_child].

method.name: update_property
method.description: When this virtual function is called, you must update your editor.

class.name: EditorProperty

signal.name: multiple_properties_changed
signal.description: Emit it if you want multiple properties modified at the same time. Do not use if added via [method EditorInspectorPlugin.parse_property].

signal.name: object_id_selected
signal.description: Used by sub-inspectors. Emit it if what was selected was an Object ID.

signal.name: property_changed
signal.description: Do not emit this manually, use the [method emit_changed] method instead.

signal.name: property_checked
signal.description: Emitted when a property was checked. Used internally.

signal.name: property_keyed
signal.description: Emit it if you want to add this value as an animation key (check for keying being enabled first).

signal.name: property_keyed_with_value
signal.description: Emit it if you want to key a property with a single value.

signal.name: resource_selected
signal.description: If you want a sub-resource to be edited, emit this signal with the resource.

signal.name: selected
signal.description: Emitted when selected. Used internally.

class.brief_description: Custom control to edit properties for adding into the inspector.
class.description: This control allows property editing for one or multiple properties into [EditorInspector]. It is added via [EditorInspectorPlugin].

method.name: can_generate_small_preview
method.description:
If this function returns [code]true[/code], the generator will call [method generate] or [method generate_from_path] for small previews as well.
				By default, it returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: generate
method.description:
Generate a preview from a given resource with the specified size. This must always be implemented.
				Returning an empty texture is an OK way to fail and let another generator take care.
				Care must be taken because this function is always called from a thread (not the main thread).

method.name: generate_from_path
method.description:
Generate a preview directly from a path with the specified size. Implementing this is optional, as default code will load and call [method generate].
				Returning an empty texture is an OK way to fail and let another generator take care.
				Care must be taken because this function is always called from a thread (not the main thread).

method.name: generate_small_preview_automatically
method.description:
If this function returns [code]true[/code], the generator will automatically generate the small previews from the normal preview texture generated by the methods [method generate] or [method generate_from_path].
				By default, it returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: handles
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if your generator supports the resource of type [code]type[/code].

class.name: EditorResourcePreviewGenerator
class.brief_description: Custom generator of previews.
class.description: Custom code to generate previews. Please check [code]file_dialog/thumbnail_size[/code] in [EditorSettings] to find out the right size to do previews at.

method.name: add_preview_generator
method.description: Create an own, custom preview generator.

method.name: check_for_invalidation
method.description: Check if the resource changed, if so, it will be invalidated and the corresponding signal emitted.

method.name: queue_edited_resource_preview
method.description:
Queue the [code]resource[/code] being edited for preview. Once the preview is ready, the [code]receiver[/code]'s [code]receiver_func[/code] will be called. The [code]receiver_func[/code] must take the following four arguments: [String] path, [Texture] preview, [Texture] thumbnail_preview, [Variant] userdata. [code]userdata[/code] can be anything, and will be returned when [code]receiver_func[/code] is called.
				[b]Note[/b]: If it was not possible to create the preview the [code]receiver_func[/code] will still be called, but the preview will be null.

method.name: queue_resource_preview
method.description:
Queue a resource file located at [code]path[/code] for preview. Once the preview is ready, the [code]receiver[/code]'s [code]receiver_func[/code] will be called. The [code]receiver_func[/code] must take the following four arguments: [String] path, [Texture] preview, [Texture] thumbnail_preview, [Variant] userdata. [code]userdata[/code] can be anything, and will be returned when [code]receiver_func[/code] is called.
				[b]Note[/b]: If it was not possible to create the preview the [code]receiver_func[/code] will still be called, but the preview will be null.

method.name: remove_preview_generator
method.description: Removes a custom preview generator.

class.name: EditorResourcePreview

signal.name: preview_invalidated
signal.description: Emitted if a preview was invalidated (changed). [code]path[/code] corresponds to the path of the preview.

class.brief_description: Helper to generate previews of resources or files.
class.description:
This object is used to generate previews for resources of files.
		[b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorInterface.get_resource_previewer].

class.name: EditorSceneImporter
class.brief_description: Imports scenes from third-parties' 3D files.

method.name: get_source_file
method.description: Returns the source file path which got imported (e.g. [code]res://scene.dae[/code]).

method.name: get_source_folder
method.description: Returns the resource folder the imported scene file is located in.

method.name: post_import
method.description: Called after the scene was imported. This method must return the modified version of the scene.

class.name: EditorScenePostImport
class.brief_description: Post-processes scenes after import.
class.description:
Imported scenes can be automatically modified right after import by setting their [b]Custom Script[/b] Import property to a [code]tool[/code] script that inherits from this class.
		The [method post_import] callback receives the imported scene's root node and returns the modified version of the scene. Usage example:
		[codeblock]
		tool # Needed so it runs in editor
		extends EditorScenePostImport

		# This sample changes all node names

		# Called right after the scene is imported and gets the root node
		func post_import(scene):
		    # Change all node names to "modified_[oldnodename]"
		    iterate(scene)
		    return scene # Remember to return the imported scene

		func iterate(node):
		    if node != null:
		        node.name = "modified_" + node.name
		        for child in node.get_children():
		            iterate(child)
		[/codeblock]

method.name: _run
method.description: This method is executed by the Editor when [b]File > Run[/b] is used.

method.name: add_root_node
method.description:
Adds [code]node[/code] as a child of the root node in the editor context.
				[b]Warning:[/b] The implementation of this method is currently disabled.

method.name: get_editor_interface
method.description: Returns the [EditorInterface] singleton instance.

method.name: get_scene
method.description: Returns the Editor's currently active scene.

class.name: EditorScript
class.brief_description: Base script that can be used to add extension functions to the editor.
class.description:
Scripts extending this class and implementing its [method _run] method can be executed from the Script Editor's [b]File > Run[/b] menu option (or by pressing [code]Ctrl+Shift+X[/code]) while the editor is running. This is useful for adding custom in-editor functionality to Godot. For more complex additions, consider using [EditorPlugin]s instead.
		[b]Note:[/b] Extending scripts need to have [code]tool[/code] mode enabled.
		[b]Example script:[/b]
		[codeblock]
		tool
		extends EditorScript

		func _run():
		    print("Hello from the Godot Editor!")
		[/codeblock]
		[b]Note:[/b] The script is run in the Editor context, which means the output is visible in the console window started with the Editor (stdout) instead of the usual Godot [b]Output[/b] dock.

method.name: add_node
method.description:
Adds a node to the selection.
				[b]Note:[/b] The newly selected node will not be automatically edited in the inspector. If you want to edit a node, use [method EditorInterface.edit_node].

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the selection.

method.name: get_selected_nodes
method.description: Gets the list of selected nodes.

method.name: get_transformable_selected_nodes
method.description: Gets the list of selected nodes, optimized for transform operations (i.e. moving them, rotating, etc). This list avoids situations where a node is selected and also child/grandchild.

method.name: remove_node
method.description: Removes a node from the selection.

class.name: EditorSelection

signal.name: selection_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the selection changes.

class.brief_description: Manages the SceneTree selection in the editor.
class.description:
This object manages the SceneTree selection in the editor.
		[b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorInterface.get_selection].

method.name: add_property_info
method.description:
Adds a custom property info to a property. The dictionary must contain:
				- [code]name[/code]: [String] (the name of the property)
				- [code]type[/code]: [int] (see [enum Variant.Type])
				- optionally [code]hint[/code]: [int] (see [enum PropertyHint]) and [code]hint_string[/code]: [String]
				[b]Example:[/b]
				[codeblock]
				editor_settings.set("category/property_name", 0)

				var property_info = {
				    "name": "category/property_name",
				    "type": TYPE_INT,
				    "hint": PROPERTY_HINT_ENUM,
				    "hint_string": "one,two,three"
				}

				editor_settings.add_property_info(property_info)
				[/codeblock]

method.name: erase
method.description: Erases the setting whose name is specified by [code]property[/code].

method.name: get_favorites
method.description: Returns the list of favorite files and directories for this project.

method.name: get_project_metadata
method.description: Returns project-specific metadata for the [code]section[/code] and [code]key[/code] specified. If the metadata doesn't exist, [code]default[/code] will be returned instead. See also [method set_project_metadata].

method.name: get_project_settings_dir
method.description: Returns the project-specific settings path. Projects all have a unique subdirectory inside the settings path where project-specific settings are saved.

method.name: get_recent_dirs
method.description: Returns the list of recently visited folders in the file dialog for this project.

method.name: get_setting
method.description: Returns the value of the setting specified by [code]name[/code]. This is equivalent to using [method Object.get] on the EditorSettings instance.

method.name: get_settings_dir
method.description:
Gets the global settings path for the engine. Inside this path, you can find some standard paths such as:
				[code]settings/tmp[/code] - Used for temporary storage of files
				[code]settings/templates[/code] - Where export templates are located

method.name: has_setting
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the setting specified by [code]name[/code] exists, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: property_can_revert
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the setting specified by [code]name[/code] can have its value reverted to the default value, [code]false[/code] otherwise. When this method returns [code]true[/code], a Revert button will display next to the setting in the Editor Settings.

method.name: property_get_revert
method.description: Returns the default value of the setting specified by [code]name[/code]. This is the value that would be applied when clicking the Revert button in the Editor Settings.

method.name: set_favorites
method.description: Sets the list of favorite files and directories for this project.

method.name: set_initial_value
method.description: Sets the initial value of the setting specified by [code]name[/code] to [code]value[/code]. This is used to provide a value for the Revert button in the Editor Settings. If [code]update_current[/code] is true, the current value of the setting will be set to [code]value[/code] as well.

method.name: set_project_metadata
method.description: Sets project-specific metadata with the [code]section[/code], [code]key[/code] and [code]data[/code] specified. This metadata is stored outside the project folder and therefore won't be checked into version control. See also [method get_project_metadata].

method.name: set_recent_dirs
method.description: Sets the list of recently visited folders in the file dialog for this project.

method.name: set_setting
method.description: Sets the [code]value[/code] of the setting specified by [code]name[/code]. This is equivalent to using [method Object.set] on the EditorSettings instance.

class.name: EditorSettings

signal.name: settings_changed
signal.description: Emitted after any editor setting has changed.

class.brief_description: Object that holds the project-independent editor settings.
class.description:
Object that holds the project-independent editor settings. These settings are generally visible in the [b]Editor > Editor Settings[/b] menu.
		Property names use slash delimiters to distinguish sections. Setting values can be of any [Variant] type. It's recommended to use [code]snake_case[/code] for editor settings to be consistent with the Godot editor itself.
		Accessing the settings can be done using the following methods, such as:
		[codeblock]
		# `settings.set("some/property", value)` also works as this class overrides `_set()` internally.
		settings.set_setting("some/property",value)

		# `settings.get("some/property", value)` also works as this class overrides `_get()` internally.
		settings.get_setting("some/property")

		var list_of_settings = settings.get_property_list()
		[/codeblock]
		[b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorInterface.get_editor_settings].

method.name: add_material
method.description: Adds a new material to the internal material list for the plugin. It can then be accessed with [method get_material]. Should not be overridden.

method.name: can_be_hidden
method.description: Override this method to define whether the gizmo can be hidden or not. Returns [code]true[/code] if not overridden.

method.name: commit_handle
method.description: Override this method to commit gizmo handles. Called for this plugin's active gizmos.

method.name: create_gizmo
method.description: Override this method to return a custom [EditorSpatialGizmo] for the spatial nodes of your choice, return [code]null[/code] for the rest of nodes. See also [method has_gizmo].

method.name: create_handle_material
method.description: Creates a handle material with its variants (selected and/or editable) and adds them to the internal material list. They can then be accessed with [method get_material] and used in [method EditorSpatialGizmo.add_handles]. Should not be overridden.

method.name: create_icon_material
method.description: Creates an icon material with its variants (selected and/or editable) and adds them to the internal material list. They can then be accessed with [method get_material] and used in [method EditorSpatialGizmo.add_unscaled_billboard]. Should not be overridden.

method.name: create_material
method.description: Creates an unshaded material with its variants (selected and/or editable) and adds them to the internal material list. They can then be accessed with [method get_material] and used in [method EditorSpatialGizmo.add_mesh] and [method EditorSpatialGizmo.add_lines]. Should not be overridden.

method.name: get_handle_name
method.description: Override this method to provide gizmo's handle names. Called for this plugin's active gizmos.

method.name: get_handle_value
method.description: Gets actual value of a handle from gizmo. Called for this plugin's active gizmos.

method.name: get_material
method.description: Gets material from the internal list of materials. If an [EditorSpatialGizmo] is provided, it will try to get the corresponding variant (selected and/or editable).

method.name: get_name
method.description: Override this method to provide the name that will appear in the gizmo visibility menu.

method.name: get_priority
method.description:
Override this method to set the gizmo's priority. Higher values correspond to higher priority. If a gizmo with higher priority conflicts with another gizmo, only the gizmo with higher priority will be used.
				All built-in editor gizmos return a priority of [code]-1[/code]. If not overridden, this method will return [code]0[/code], which means custom gizmos will automatically override built-in gizmos.

method.name: has_gizmo
method.description: Override this method to define which Spatial nodes have a gizmo from this plugin. Whenever a [Spatial] node is added to a scene this method is called, if it returns [code]true[/code] the node gets a generic [EditorSpatialGizmo] assigned and is added to this plugin's list of active gizmos.

method.name: is_handle_highlighted
method.description: Gets whether a handle is highlighted or not. Called for this plugin's active gizmos.

method.name: is_selectable_when_hidden
method.description: Override this method to define whether a Spatial with this gizmo should be selectable even when the gizmo is hidden.

method.name: redraw
method.description: Callback to redraw the provided gizmo. Called for this plugin's active gizmos.

method.name: set_handle
method.description: Update the value of a handle after it has been updated. Called for this plugin's active gizmos.

class.name: EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin
class.brief_description: Used by the editor to define Spatial gizmo types.
class.description: EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin allows you to define a new type of Gizmo. There are two main ways to do so: extending [EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin] for the simpler gizmos, or creating a new [EditorSpatialGizmo] type. See the tutorial in the documentation for more info.

method.name: add_collision_segments
method.description: Adds the specified [code]segments[/code] to the gizmo's collision shape for picking. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_collision_triangles
method.description: Adds collision triangles to the gizmo for picking. A [TriangleMesh] can be generated from a regular [Mesh] too. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_handles
method.description:
Adds a list of handles (points) which can be used to deform the object being edited.
				There are virtual functions which will be called upon editing of these handles. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_lines
method.description: Adds lines to the gizmo (as sets of 2 points), with a given material. The lines are used for visualizing the gizmo. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_mesh
method.description: Adds a mesh to the gizmo with the specified [code]billboard[/code] state, [code]skeleton[/code] and [code]material[/code]. If [code]billboard[/code] is [code]true[/code], the mesh will rotate to always face the camera. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_unscaled_billboard
method.description: Adds an unscaled billboard for visualization. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes everything in the gizmo including meshes, collisions and handles.

method.name: commit_handle
method.description:
Commit a handle being edited (handles must have been previously added by [method add_handles]).
				If the [code]cancel[/code] parameter is [code]true[/code], an option to restore the edited value to the original is provided.

method.name: get_handle_name
method.description:
Gets the name of an edited handle (handles must have been previously added by [method add_handles]).
				Handles can be named for reference to the user when editing.

method.name: get_handle_value
method.description: Gets actual value of a handle. This value can be anything and used for eventually undoing the motion when calling [method commit_handle].

method.name: get_plugin
method.description: Returns the [EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin] that owns this gizmo. It's useful to retrieve materials using [method EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin.get_material].

method.name: get_spatial_node
method.description: Returns the Spatial node associated with this gizmo.

method.name: is_handle_highlighted
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the handle at index [code]index[/code] is highlighted by being hovered with the mouse.

method.name: redraw
method.description: This function is called when the [Spatial] this gizmo refers to changes (the [method Spatial.update_gizmo] is called).

method.name: set_handle
method.description:
This function is used when the user drags a gizmo handle (previously added with [method add_handles]) in screen coordinates.
				The [Camera] is also provided so screen coordinates can be converted to raycasts.

method.name: set_hidden
method.description: Sets the gizmo's hidden state. If [code]true[/code], the gizmo will be hidden. If [code]false[/code], it will be shown.

method.name: set_spatial_node
method.description: Sets the reference [Spatial] node for the gizmo. [code]node[/code] must inherit from [Spatial].

class.name: EditorSpatialGizmo
class.brief_description: Custom gizmo for editing Spatial objects.
class.description: Custom gizmo that is used for providing custom visualization and editing (handles) for 3D Spatial objects. See [EditorSpatialGizmoPlugin] for more information.

method.name: commit
method.description: Creates a version commit if the addon is initialized, else returns without doing anything. Uses the files which have been staged previously, with the commit message set to a value as provided as in the argument.

method.name: get_file_diff
method.description:
Returns an [Array] of [Dictionary] objects containing the diff output from the VCS in use, if a VCS addon is initialized, else returns an empty [Array] object. The diff contents also consist of some contextual lines which provide context to the observed line change in the file.
				Each [Dictionary] object has the line diff contents under the keys:
				- [code]"content"[/code] to store a [String] containing the line contents
				- [code]"status"[/code] to store a [String] which contains [code]"+"[/code] in case the content is a line addition but it stores a [code]"-"[/code] in case of deletion and an empty string in the case the line content is neither an addition nor a deletion.
				- [code]"new_line_number"[/code] to store an integer containing the new line number of the line content.
				- [code]"line_count"[/code] to store an integer containing the number of lines in the line content.
				- [code]"old_line_number"[/code] to store an integer containing the old line number of the line content.
				- [code]"offset"[/code] to store the offset of the line change since the first contextual line content.

method.name: get_modified_files_data
method.description:
Returns a [Dictionary] containing the path of the detected file change mapped to an integer signifying what kind of change the corresponding file has experienced.
				The following integer values are being used to signify that the detected file is:
				- [code]0[/code]: New to the VCS working directory
				- [code]1[/code]: Modified
				- [code]2[/code]: Renamed
				- [code]3[/code]: Deleted
				- [code]4[/code]: Typechanged

method.name: get_project_name
method.description: Returns the project name of the VCS working directory.

method.name: get_vcs_name
method.description: Returns the name of the VCS if the VCS has been initialized, else return an empty string.

method.name: initialize
method.description: Initializes the VCS addon if not already. Uses the argument value as the path to the working directory of the project. Creates the initial commit if required. Returns [code]true[/code] if no failure occurs, else returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: is_addon_ready
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the addon is ready to respond to function calls, else returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: is_vcs_initialized
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the VCS addon has been initialized, else returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: shut_down
method.description: Shuts down the VCS addon to allow cleanup code to run on call. Returns [code]true[/code] is no failure occurs, else returns [code]false[/code].

method.name: stage_file
method.description: Stages the file which should be committed when [method EditorVCSInterface.commit] is called. Argument should contain the absolute path.

method.name: unstage_file
method.description: Unstages the file which was staged previously to be committed, so that it is no longer committed when [method EditorVCSInterface.commit] is called. Argument should contain the absolute path.

class.name: EditorVCSInterface
class.brief_description: Version Control System (VCS) interface which reads and writes to the local VCS in use.
class.description: Used by the editor to display VCS extracted information in the editor. The implementation of this API is included in VCS addons, which are essentially GDNative plugins that need to be put into the project folder. These VCS addons are scripts which are attached (on demand) to the object instance of [code]EditorVCSInterface[/code]. All the functions listed below, instead of performing the task themselves, they call the internally defined functions in the VCS addons to provide a plug-n-play experience.

member.value: The [Object] identifier stored in this [EncodedObjectAsID] instance. The object instance can be retrieved with [method @GDScript.instance_from_id].
member.name: object_id

class.name: EncodedObjectAsID
class.brief_description: Holds a reference to an [Object]'s instance ID.
class.description:
Utility class which holds a reference to the internal identifier of an [Object] instance, as given by [method Object.get_instance_id]. This ID can then be used to retrieve the object instance with [method @GDScript.instance_from_id].
		This class is used internally by the editor inspector and script debugger, but can also be used in plugins to pass and display objects as their IDs.

member.value:
If [code]true[/code], the script is currently running inside the editor. This is useful for [code]tool[/code] scripts to conditionally draw editor helpers, or prevent accidentally running "game" code that would affect the scene state while in the editor:
			[codeblock]
			if Engine.editor_hint:
			    draw_gizmos()
			else:
			    simulate_physics()
			[/codeblock]
			See [url=https://docs.godotengine.org/en/3.3/tutorials/misc/running_code_in_the_editor.html]Running code in the editor[/url] in the documentation for more information.
			[b]Note:[/b] To detect whether the script is run from an editor [i]build[/i] (e.g. when pressing [code]F5[/code]), use [method OS.has_feature] with the [code]"editor"[/code] argument instead. [code]OS.has_feature("editor")[/code] will evaluate to [code]true[/code] both when the code is running in the editor and when running the project from the editor, but it will evaluate to [code]false[/code] when the code is run from an exported project.
member.name: editor_hint

member.value: The number of fixed iterations per second. This controls how often physics simulation and [method Node._physics_process] methods are run. This value should generally always be set to [code]60[/code] or above, as Godot doesn't interpolate the physics step. As a result, values lower than [code]60[/code] will look stuttery. This value can be increased to make input more reactive or work around tunneling issues, but keep in mind doing so will increase CPU usage.
member.name: iterations_per_second

member.value:
Controls how much physics ticks are synchronized with real time. For 0 or less, the ticks are synchronized. Such values are recommended for network games, where clock synchronization matters. Higher values cause higher deviation of the in-game clock and real clock but smooth out framerate jitters. The default value of 0.5 should be fine for most; values above 2 could cause the game to react to dropped frames with a noticeable delay and are not recommended.
			[b]Note:[/b] For best results, when using a custom physics interpolation solution, the physics jitter fix should be disabled by setting [member physics_jitter_fix] to [code]0[/code].
member.name: physics_jitter_fix

member.value: The desired frames per second. If the hardware cannot keep up, this setting may not be respected. A value of 0 means no limit.
member.name: target_fps

member.value: Controls how fast or slow the in-game clock ticks versus the real life one. It defaults to 1.0. A value of 2.0 means the game moves twice as fast as real life, whilst a value of 0.5 means the game moves at half the regular speed.
member.name: time_scale

method.name: get_author_info
method.description:
Returns engine author information in a Dictionary.
				[code]lead_developers[/code]    - Array of Strings, lead developer names
				[code]founders[/code]           - Array of Strings, founder names
				[code]project_managers[/code]   - Array of Strings, project manager names
				[code]developers[/code]         - Array of Strings, developer names

method.name: get_copyright_info
method.description:
Returns an Array of copyright information Dictionaries.
				[code]name[/code]    - String, component name
				[code]parts[/code]   - Array of Dictionaries {[code]files[/code], [code]copyright[/code], [code]license[/code]} describing subsections of the component

method.name: get_donor_info
method.description:
Returns a Dictionary of Arrays of donor names.
				{[code]platinum_sponsors[/code], [code]gold_sponsors[/code], [code]silver_sponsors[/code], [code]bronze_sponsors[/code], [code]mini_sponsors[/code], [code]gold_donors[/code], [code]silver_donors[/code], [code]bronze_donors[/code]}

method.name: get_frames_drawn
method.description: Returns the total number of frames drawn. If the render loop is disabled with [code]--disable-render-loop[/code] via command line, this returns [code]0[/code]. See also [method get_idle_frames].

method.name: get_frames_per_second
method.description: Returns the frames per second of the running game.

method.name: get_idle_frames
method.description: Returns the total number of frames passed since engine initialization which is advanced on each [b]idle frame[/b], regardless of whether the render loop is enabled. See also [method get_frames_drawn].

method.name: get_license_info
method.description: Returns Dictionary of licenses used by Godot and included third party components.

method.name: get_license_text
method.description: Returns Godot license text.

method.name: get_main_loop
method.description: Returns the main loop object (see [MainLoop] and [SceneTree]).

method.name: get_physics_frames
method.description: Returns the total number of frames passed since engine initialization which is advanced on each [b]physics frame[/b].

method.name: get_physics_interpolation_fraction
method.description: Returns the fraction through the current physics tick we are at the time of rendering the frame. This can be used to implement fixed timestep interpolation.

method.name: get_singleton
method.description: Returns a global singleton with given [code]name[/code]. Often used for plugins, e.g. [code]GodotPayment[/code] on Android.

method.name: get_version_info
method.description:
Returns the current engine version information in a Dictionary.
				[code]major[/code]    - Holds the major version number as an int
				[code]minor[/code]    - Holds the minor version number as an int
				[code]patch[/code]    - Holds the patch version number as an int
				[code]hex[/code]      - Holds the full version number encoded as a hexadecimal int with one byte (2 places) per number (see example below)
				[code]status[/code]   - Holds the status (e.g. "beta", "rc1", "rc2", ... "stable") as a String
				[code]build[/code]    - Holds the build name (e.g. "custom_build") as a String
				[code]hash[/code]     - Holds the full Git commit hash as a String
				[code]year[/code]     - Holds the year the version was released in as an int
				[code]string[/code]   - [code]major[/code] + [code]minor[/code] + [code]patch[/code] + [code]status[/code] + [code]build[/code] in a single String
				The [code]hex[/code] value is encoded as follows, from left to right: one byte for the major, one byte for the minor, one byte for the patch version. For example, "3.1.12" would be [code]0x03010C[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] It's still an int internally, and printing it will give you its decimal representation, which is not particularly meaningful. Use hexadecimal literals for easy version comparisons from code:
				[codeblock]
				if Engine.get_version_info().hex >= 0x030200:
				    # Do things specific to version 3.2 or later
				else:
				    # Do things specific to versions before 3.2
				[/codeblock]

method.name: has_singleton
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if a singleton with given [code]name[/code] exists in global scope.

method.name: is_in_physics_frame
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the game is inside the fixed process and physics phase of the game loop.

class.name: Engine
class.brief_description: Access to engine properties.
class.description: The [Engine] singleton allows you to query and modify the project's run-time parameters, such as frames per second, time scale, and others.

member.value: The global brightness value of the rendered scene. Effective only if [code]adjustment_enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code].
member.name: adjustment_brightness

member.value: Applies the provided [Texture] resource to affect the global color aspect of the rendered scene. Effective only if [code]adjustment_enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code].
member.name: adjustment_color_correction

member.value: The global contrast value of the rendered scene (default value is 1). Effective only if [code]adjustment_enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code].
member.name: adjustment_contrast

member.value: If [code]true[/code], enables the [code]adjustment_*[/code] properties provided by this resource. If [code]false[/code], modifications to the [code]adjustment_*[/code] properties will have no effect on the rendered scene.
member.name: adjustment_enabled

member.value: The global color saturation value of the rendered scene (default value is 1). Effective only if [code]adjustment_enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code].
member.name: adjustment_saturation

member.value: The ambient light's [Color].
member.name: ambient_light_color

member.value: The ambient light's energy. The higher the value, the stronger the light.
member.name: ambient_light_energy

member.value: Defines the amount of light that the sky brings on the scene. A value of 0 means that the sky's light emission has no effect on the scene illumination, thus all ambient illumination is provided by the ambient light. On the contrary, a value of 1 means that all the light that affects the scene is provided by the sky, thus the ambient light parameter has no effect on the scene.
member.name: ambient_light_sky_contribution

member.value: If [code]true[/code], enables the tonemapping auto exposure mode of the scene renderer. If [code]true[/code], the renderer will automatically determine the exposure setting to adapt to the scene's illumination and the observed light.
member.name: auto_exposure_enabled

member.value: The maximum luminance value for the auto exposure.
member.name: auto_exposure_max_luma

member.value: The minimum luminance value for the auto exposure.
member.name: auto_exposure_min_luma

member.value: The scale of the auto exposure effect. Affects the intensity of auto exposure.
member.name: auto_exposure_scale

member.value: The speed of the auto exposure effect. Affects the time needed for the camera to perform auto exposure.
member.name: auto_exposure_speed

member.value: The ID of the camera feed to show in the background.
member.name: background_camera_feed_id

member.value: The maximum layer ID to display. Only effective when using the [constant BG_CANVAS] background mode.
member.name: background_canvas_max_layer

member.value: The [Color] displayed for clear areas of the scene. Only effective when using the [constant BG_COLOR] or [constant BG_COLOR_SKY] background modes).
member.name: background_color

member.value: The power of the light emitted by the background.
member.name: background_energy

member.value: The background mode. See [enum BGMode] for possible values.
member.name: background_mode

member.value: The [Sky] resource defined as background.
member.name: background_sky

member.value: The [Sky] resource's custom field of view.
member.name: background_sky_custom_fov

member.value: The [Sky] resource's rotation expressed as a [Basis].
member.name: background_sky_orientation

member.value: The [Sky] resource's rotation expressed as Euler angles in radians.
member.name: background_sky_rotation

member.value: The [Sky] resource's rotation expressed as Euler angles in degrees.
member.name: background_sky_rotation_degrees

member.value: The amount of far blur for the depth-of-field effect.
member.name: dof_blur_far_amount

member.value: The distance from the camera where the far blur effect affects the rendering.
member.name: dof_blur_far_distance

member.value: If [code]true[/code], enables the depth-of-field far blur effect.
member.name: dof_blur_far_enabled

member.value: The depth-of-field far blur's quality. Higher values can mitigate the visible banding effect seen at higher strengths, but are much slower.
member.name: dof_blur_far_quality

member.name: dof_blur_far_transition

member.value: The amount of near blur for the depth-of-field effect.
member.name: dof_blur_near_amount

member.value: Distance from the camera where the near blur effect affects the rendering.
member.name: dof_blur_near_distance

member.value: If [code]true[/code], enables the depth-of-field near blur effect.
member.name: dof_blur_near_enabled

member.value: The depth-of-field near blur's quality. Higher values can mitigate the visible banding effect seen at higher strengths, but are much slower.
member.name: dof_blur_near_quality

member.value: The length of the transition between the near blur and no-blur area.
member.name: dof_blur_near_transition

member.value: The fog's [Color].
member.name: fog_color

member.value: The fog's depth starting distance from the camera.
member.name: fog_depth_begin

member.value: The fog depth's intensity curve. A number of presets are available in the [b]Inspector[/b] by right-clicking the curve.
member.name: fog_depth_curve

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the depth fog effect is enabled. When enabled, fog will appear in the distance (relative to the camera).
member.name: fog_depth_enabled

member.value: The fog's depth end distance from the camera. If this value is set to 0, it will be equal to the current camera's [member Camera.far] value.
member.name: fog_depth_end

member.value: If [code]true[/code], fog effects are enabled. [member fog_height_enabled] and/or [member fog_depth_enabled] must be set to [code]true[/code] to actually display fog.
member.name: fog_enabled

member.value: The height fog's intensity. A number of presets are available in the [b]Inspector[/b] by right-clicking the curve.
member.name: fog_height_curve

member.value: If [code]true[/code], the height fog effect is enabled. When enabled, fog will appear in a defined height range, regardless of the distance from the camera. This can be used to simulate "deep water" effects with a lower performance cost compared to a dedicated shader.
member.name: fog_height_enabled

member.value: The Y coordinate where the height fog will be the most intense. If this value is greater than [member fog_height_min], fog will be displayed from bottom to top. Otherwise, it will be displayed from top to bottom.
member.name: fog_height_max

member.value: The Y coordinate where the height fog will be the least intense. If this value is greater than [member fog_height_max], fog will be displayed from top to bottom. Otherwise, it will be displayed from bottom to top.
member.name: fog_height_min

member.value: The intensity of the depth fog color transition when looking towards the sun. The sun's direction is determined automatically using the DirectionalLight node in the scene.

member.value: The depth fog's [Color] when looking towards the sun.
